parameters.name: details
parameters.description: level of information returned

methods.description: Requests thousands of screenshtos at once

parameters.name: hosting
parameters.description: hosting option - s3 or browshot

parameters.name: hostingHeight
parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host

parameters.name: hostingWidth
parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host

parameters.name: hostingScale
parameters.description: scale of the thumbnail to host

parameters.name: hostingBucket
parameters.description: S3 bucket to upload the screenshot or thumbnail (required for S3)

parameters.name: hostingFile
parameters.description: file name to use (for S3 only)

parameters.name: hostingHeaders
parameters.description: list of headers to add to the S3 object (for S3 only)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: batch ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: browser ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: instance ID

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the page to get a screenshot for

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: instance ID to use

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: screenshot size - "screen" (default) or "page"

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: use a previous screenshot (same URL, same instance) if it was done within <cache_value> seconds. The default value is 24hours. Specify cache=0 if you want a new screenshot.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded. This is used to let JavaScript run longer before taking the screenshot. Use delay=0 to take screenshots faster.

parameters.name: flashDelay
parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded if Flash elements are present. Use flash_delay=0 to take screenshots faster.

parameters.name: screenWidth
parameters.description: width of the browser window. For desktop browsers only.

parameters.name: screenHeight
parameters.description: height of the browser window. For desktop browsers only. (Note: full-page screenshots can have a height of up to 15,000px)

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: assign priority to the screenshot (for private instances only)

parameters.name: referer
parameters.description: use a custom referrer header - paid screenshots only

parameters.name: postData
parameters.description: send a POST requests with post_data, useful for filling out forms - paid screenshots only

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: set a cookie for the URL requested (see Custom POST Data, Referer and Cookie) Cookies should be separated by a ; - paid screenshots only

parameters.name: script
parameters.description: URL of javascript file to execute after the page load event

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: level of information available with screenshot/info

parameters.name: html
parameters.description: saves the HTML of the rendered page which can be retrieved by the API call screenshot/html. This feature costs *1 credit* per screenshot.

parameters.name: maxWait
parameters.description: maximum number of seconds to wait before triggering the PageLoad event. Note that delay will still be used. (default: 0 = disabled)

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: any custom HTTP headers. (Not supported with Internet Explorer)

parameters.name: shots
parameters.description: take multiple screenshots of the same page. This costs 1 additional credit for every 2 additional screenshots.

parameters.name: shotInterval
parameters.description: number of seconds between 2 screenshots

parameters.name: hosting
parameters.description: hosting option - s3 or browshot

parameters.name: hostingHeight
parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host

parameters.name: hostingWidth
parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host

parameters.name: hostingScale
parameters.description: scale of the thumbnail to host

parameters.name: hostingBucket
parameters.description: S3 bucket to upload the screenshot or thumbnail (required for S3)

parameters.name: hostingFile
parameters.description: file name to use (for S3 only)

parameters.name: hostingHeaders
parameters.description: list of headers to add to the S3 object (for S3 only)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: screenshot ID

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: data to remove. You can specify multiple of them (separated by a ,): *image* (image files), *url* (url requested), *metadata* (time added, time finished, post data, cookie and referer used for the screenshot), *all* (all data and files)

methods.description: Host thumbnails on your own S3 account or on Browshot.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: screenshot ID

parameters.name: hosting
parameters.description: hosting option: s3 or browshot

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: width of the thumbnail

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: scale of the thumbnail

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: S3 bucket to upload the screenshot or thumbnail - required with hosting=s3

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: file name to use - optional, used with hosting=s3

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: HTTP headers to add to your S3 object - optional, used with hosting=s3

parameters.description: screenshot ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: screenshot ID received from /api/v1/screenshot/create

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: level of details about the screenshot and the page

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: maximum number of screenshots' information to return

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: get list of screenshot in a given status (error, finished, in_process)

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the page to get a screenshot for. You can specify multiple url parameters (up to 10).

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: instance ID to use. You can specify multiple instance_id parameters (up to 10).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: screenshot size - "screen" (default) or "page"

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: use a previous screenshot (same URL, same instance) if it was done within <cache_value> seconds. The default value is 24hours. Specify cache=0 if you want a new screenshot.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded. This is used to let JavaScript run longer before taking the screenshot. Use delay=0 to take screenshots faster.

parameters.name: flashDelay
parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded if Flash elements are present. Use flash_delay=0 to take screenshots faster.

parameters.name: screenWidth
parameters.description: width of the browser window. For desktop browsers only.

parameters.name: screenHeight
parameters.description: height of the browser window. For desktop browsers only. (Note: full-page screenshots can have a height of up to 15,000px)

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: assign priority to the screenshot (for private instances only)

parameters.name: referer
parameters.description: use a custom referrer header - paid screenshots only

parameters.name: postData
parameters.description: send a POST requests with post_data, useful for filling out forms - paid screenshots only

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: set a cookie for the URL requested (see Custom POST Data, Referer and Cookie) Cookies should be separated by a ; - paid screenshots only

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: look for a string matching the URL requested

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: maximum number of screenshots' information to return

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: get list of screenshot in a given status (error, finished, in_process)

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: note
parameters.description: note to add on the sharing page

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: screenshot ID

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: width of the thumbnail

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: scale of the thumbnail

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: zoom 1 to 100 percent

parameters.name: ratio
parameters.description: Use fit to keep the original page ration, and fill to get a thumbnail for the exact width and height.  specified. If you provide both width and height, you need to specify the ratio: fit to keep the original width/height ratio (the thumbnail might be smaller than the specified width and height), or fill to crop the image if necessary.

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: left edge of the area to be cropped

parameters.name: right
parameters.description: right edge of the area to be cropped

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: top edge of the area to be cropped

parameters.name: bottom
parameters.description: bottom edge of the area to be cropped

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: image as PNG or JPEG

parameters.name: shot
parameters.description: get the second or third screenshot if multiple screenshots were requested

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: JPEG quality factor (for JPEG thumbnails only)

apiDescription: Take screenshots of any website in real time
